intro: Psychotria ledermannii var. cruciata, commonly known as the cruciate psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests. The species is notable for its potential pharmacological properties, though further research is needed to fully understand its botanical and medicinal significance.
